CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 27, 1957, pg. A7, reads: "South Africa Has Legal Segregation - Bishop Richard Reeves...'segregation by law' - Harris Photo." Portion of accompanying article reads: "'Everything is a major problem,' said the Rt. Rev. Richard Ambrose Reeves, Bishop of the Anglican Communion in Johannesburg, South Africa, in his address on 'Segregation in South Africa,' on July 23.  The South African Bishop addressed an audience on Tuesday night in Church of the Ascension on Ellsworth Ave.  He was touring the U. S. in interest of his work in Africa, under the auspices of the American Union of the Episcopal Church..."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Richard Ambrose Reeves, Bishop of Anglican Communion in Johannesburg, South Africa, standing in interior
